newsitem.title: CANADA: Caledonia boosts South African mine output.
newsitem.headline: Caledonia boosts South African mine output.

text.p: Caledonia Mining Corp said on Tuesday that it boosted output and recoveries at its Barbrook Mine in South Africa, and increased its measured and indicated gold reserves.
Since it started up, Barbrook has increased recoveries to the 65-70 percent range which will rise as the milling process is improved.

Also, the measured and indicated gold reserves jumped in tonnage and grade from 1996. "Measured reserves now stand at 913,000 tonnes at an undiluted grade of 6.52 g/t (grams per tonne) versus 478,000 tonnes at 5.09 g/t last year," it said. "The indicated reserves have increased to 954,000 tonnes at 6.12 g/t this year from 219,000 tonnes at 6.5 g/t last year."
Barbrook's mineral resource stands at about 11 million tonnes at a grade of 6.48 g/t containing 2.3 million ounces of gold, it said.

In March and April the plant produced about 17,000 tonnes per month which surpassed expected targets. Ore grades to the million averaged 4.33 g/t. "With the anticipated improvements, Barbrook should be profitable in the near future at present gold prices."
